subject: Ant/Junit/Package name issue?
msgSnippet: All, This issue seems to be causing by the package name of the .java file. When removing the package name, the first line from the .java file, the Ant/Junit
messageBody:
All,

This issue seems to be causing by the "package" name
of the .java file. When removing the package name, the
first line from the .java file, the Ant/Junit seems to
respond well... Please read the output below... When
the package name is in, then it complain the
ClassLoader.

How do i define the package name correctly? How can I
define the Junit tasks within the Ant to look at
correct things?

Thank you.

Barry

* Here is the Simple Junit tasks in Ant's build.xml:

<target name="test-server"
depends="compile-newserver">

<mkdir dir="${test-results}/server"/>
<echo message="JAVA_HOME is ${javaBase}"/>
<echo message="ANT_HOME is ${antBase}"/>

<junit printsummary="true" showoutput="yes">

<formatter type="brief"
usefile="false"/>
<formatter type="xml"/>


<classpath>

<pathelement
path="build/WEB-INF/classes"/>
<pathelement path="build"/>
<pathelement
path="build/WEB-INF/classes/com/elementalse
curity/server/test"/>
<pathelement
path="build/com/barry/my/"/>

</classpath>

<test name="AlwaysWillFailTest" />


<!-- Barry's test cases...

<test name="AlwaysWillFailTest" />
<test name="corruptClassTest" />

-->

</junit>

<junitreport todir="${test-results}/server">
<fileset dir=".">
<include
name="reports/test-results/server/TEST-*.xml"/>
</fileset>
<report format="frames"
todir="${test-reports}/server"/>
</junitreport>
<echo message="junitreport done..."/>

</target>

> Here is the Junit code:
>

> package com.elementalsecurity.server.test;
>
> /**
> * Element Security. All Rights Reserved, 2003.
> * User: Stefan Gower
> * Date: Oct 30, 2003
> * Time: 12:26:05 PM

>
>
> import junit.framework.TestCase;
>
> import junit.framework.TestSuite;
>
> import junit.framework.Test;
>

> /** A JUnit test. **/
>
>
> public class AlwaysWillFailTest extends TestCase {
>
>
> /**
>
> * Constructor for test case.
>
> */
>
> public AlwaysWillFailTest(String name) {
>
> super(name);
>
> }
>
>
> /**
>
> * Entry point for running the
>
> * test from the command line.
>
> */
>
> public static void main(String[] args) {
>
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
>
> }
>
>
> /** Set up the test. **/
>
>
> protected void setUp() {
>
> // do setup here...
>
> }
>
>
> /** Tear down the test. **/
>
>

>
> // tear down the test here...
>
> }
>
>
> /** Run test test suite. **/
>
>
> public static Test suite() {
>
> TestSuite suite = new
> TestSuite(AlwaysWillFailTest.class);
>
> return suite;
>
> }
>
>
> /** Run a basic test. **/
>
>
> public void testBasic() {
>
> public void testBasic() {
>
>
> System.out.println("Test is a test that will
> always fail...");
> fail("I am a failure!");
>
> }
>
